Result.Abstract: We consider the following (promise) problem, denoted ED (for Entropy Difference): The input is a pair of circuits, and YES instances (resp., NO instances) are such pairs in which the first (resp., second) circuit generates a distribution with noticeably higher entropy. On one hand we show that any language having a (honest-verifier) statistical zero-knowledge proof is Karp- reducible to ED.
Result.Title: Comparing Entropies in Statistical Zero Knowledge with Applications to the Structure of SZK
